issues.description: The problem statement explicitly requires that "Every class/interface has to be declared public" (line 5). The solution implementation of the Pneumatic interface is declared without the public modifier (package-private): `interface Pneumatic { ... }`. This contradicts the stated requirement and creates a visibility mismatch. Students following the instructions will declare a public interface, but the provided solution (and tests that expect public visibility) will not match the non-public interface. This can cause confusion or test failures related to accessibility/visibility of the interface.
issues.suggested_fix: Declare the Pneumatic interface as public in both template and solution. Change the declaration to: `public interface Pneumatic { void raisePressure(int pressureIncrease); void openValve(); }`. This aligns the implementation with the problem requirement that every class/interface be public and avoids visibility-related confusion or test mismatches.
